intro: Ardisia magdalenae, commonly known as the Magdalena ardisia, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture, though it remains relatively rare in the wild.
